alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 3:20PM MST until July 25 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... canyon country northeast of Page in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 318 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Labyrinth Canyon and other nearby slot canyons. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Enhanced risk for violent, life-threatening flash flooding in slot canyons and normally dry washes. Flash floods can come from distant thunderstorms, even with little or no rainfall in the immediate area.
